rules: Rule1: If the Endangered Species Project receives research funding, then research findings data get published
Rule2: If the Endangered Species Project receives research funding, then the Wildlife Rescue Center maintains operational status

Rule3: If satellite platform monitoring becomes established, then should the research program experience increased funding, then whenever rescue teams of volunteers become mobilized, endangered species animals are rescued
Rule4: Either rare species breeding proves successful or protected area habitat becomes restored
Rule5: If protected area habitat becomes restored, then Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule6: If poaching activity remains high in the protected zone, then endangered species population does not show declining trends
Rule7: If ecosystem habitat degradation becomes severe, then endangered species population does not show declining trends
Rule8: If government grant funding gets cut, then the Wildlife Rescue Center facility does not close
Rule9: Either government grant funding gets cut or public support for conservation efforts remains low
Rule10: If media coverage of the rescue facility turns negative, then under the condition that public support for conservation efforts remains low, the Wildlife Rescue Center facility does not close
Rule11: If legal action gets taken against poachers, then poaching ring arrests get made
Rule12: Either legal action gets taken against poachers or endangered species population does not show declining trends
Rule13: If rare species show recovery progress, then Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule14: If the government grant receives approval, then should the Wildlife Rescue Center maintain operational status, Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule15: Either the government grant receives approval or a major conservancy organization provides donations
Rule16: If a major conservancy organization provides donations, then provided that the Wildlife Rescue Center maintains operational status, Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule17: If the public awareness app platform launches successfully, then Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule18: Either the public awareness app platform launches successfully or rescue teams of volunteers become mobilized
Rule19: If endangered species animals are rescued, then Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
Rule20: Either the research program experiences increased funding or a corporate sponsor forms a partnership
Rule21: If a corporate sponsor forms a partnership, then under the condition that rescue teams of volunteers become mobilized, endangered species animals are rescued
Rule22: If rare species breeding proving successful does not result in rare species showing recovery progress, then UN Program international aid gets requested
Rule23: If rare species breeding proving successful does not cause rare species to show recovery progress, then Consortium emergency funding does not become activated
Rule24: If rare species breeding proving successful fails to lead to Wildlife Project conservation goals becoming achieved, then endangered species population shows declining trends
Rule25: If neither poaching activity remains high in the protected zone nor ecosystem habitat degradation becomes severe, then species conservation status shows improvement
Rule26: If research findings data getting published does not result in Wildlife Project conservation goals becoming achieved, then the Wildlife Rescue Center facility closes
Rule27: If legal action getting taken against poachers does not lead to poaching ring arrests not getting made, then conservation laws court case remains pending
Rule28: If legal action getting taken against poachers does not cause poaching ring arrests to not get made, then conservation laws court case does not remain pending
Rule29: If UN Program international aid getting requested does not trigger Consortium emergency funding becoming activated, then the rescue center facility undergoes expansion
facts: Fact1: The Endangered Species Project receives research funding
Fact2: Satellite platform monitoring becomes established
Fact3: Media coverage of the rescue facility turns negative
Fact4: Species conservation status does not show improvement
Fact5: The rescue center facility does not undergo expansion

question: Wildlife Project conservation goals become achieved
